alert.note: Alert for Forrest; Lamar (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued February 03 at 1:24PM CST until February 03 at 2:00PM CST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON FOR FORREST AND LAMAR COUNTIES... At 124 PM CST, Doppler radar continued indicate thunderstorms producing heavy rain over eastern Marion and Forrest counties. Between 3 and 4 inches of rain has fallen across southwestern Marion with widespread amounts near 2 inches across the rest of the warned area. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible. Flash flooding will continue. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Hattiesburg, Petal, West Hattiesburg, Purvis, Lumberton, Pine Ridge, Oak Grove, Rock Hill, Mclaurin, Rawls Springs, Sunrise, Baxterville and Macedonia. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
